dt: {bc}to unite or knit together in intricate confusion
{bc}to involve so as to hamper, obstruct, or embarrass
{bc}to seize and hold in or as if in a snare {bc}{sx|entrap||}
{bc}to interact in a contentious or conflicting way

et: Middle English {it}tanglen, tagilen{/it}, probably short for {it}entanglen{/it}, from Anglo-French {it}entagler, entangler{/it} to prosecute (for), implicate
shortdef: to unite or knit together in intricate confusion
to involve so as to hamper, obstruct, or embarrass
to seize and hold in or as if in a snare : entrap

dt: {bc}to fight or argue with (someone or something)

dt.t: He's not someone I would want to {it}tangle with{/it}.

shortdef: to fight or argue with (someone or something)
